repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problems:
- When the buffer is detached, the `_disable` method is invoked, setting the `client_hint` to nil.
  Subsequently, triggering the `on_win` event will result in an assertion failure (you can try `:edit`)

- At this point, reopening `inlay_hints` for this buffer will work as expected.
  However, if the buffer is detached again, the `_disable` method will not be triggered because the event has not been re-registered.
  This will result in `bufstate.applied` being equal to `bufstate.version`, causing `inlay_hints` not to be displayed unless some text is inserted to trigger a refresh.

![20240119013228_rec_](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/17252397/e1418941-45ef-4d88-b559-354a00ad8196)

Solution:
- Remove the assertion in `on_win`.

- When `bufstate.enabled` is false, reset `bufstate.applied` and set the relevant events.

comment_regular_data.body: Pardon my ignorance, but I'm having some trouble understanding why this is a problem (i.e., why we should support this scenario) and the concrete repro steps (the GIF goes a bit too fast for me).

Same issue, when I delete a file or create a new file with `inlay hints` enabled, 
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/17974631/017169cd-62d7-43cf-bd4c-92d553b72a15)
LGTM. @catlee can you take a look?

I don't know why the test failed
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/17252397/928f4ad0-7a88-4d44-aa9f-84c73314bde3)

> Pardon my ignorance, but I'm having some trouble understanding why this is a problem (i.e., why we should support this scenario) and the concrete repro steps (the GIF goes a bit too fast for me).

* This is my config, if the client supports `inlay hints`, enable it for the current buffer.
```
local servers = { "rust_analyzer", "lua_ls", "tsserver" }

for _, lsp in ipairs(servers) do
  local M = {}

  require("lspconfig")[lsp].setup({
    capabilities = require("cmp_nvim_lsp").default_capabilities(),
    -- https://neovim.io/doc/user/lsp.html#lsp-api
    handlers = {
      -- When the LSP is ready, enable inlay hint for existing bufnr again.
      -- Learn from rust-tools.nvim
      ["experimental/serverStatus"] = function(_, result, ctx, _)
        if result.quiescent and not M.ran_once then
          for _, bufnr in ipairs(vim.lsp.get_buffers_by_client_id(ctx.client_id)) do
            -- First, toggle disable because bufstate.applied
            -- prevents vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable(bufnr, true) from refreshing.
            -- Therefore, we need to clear bufstate.applied.
            vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable(bufnr, false)
            -- toggle enable
            vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable(bufnr, true)
          end
          M.ran_once = true
        end
      end,
    },
    -- If the LSP is not ready, the inlay hint character is empty,
    -- this usually occurs during the first attach.
    on_attach = function(client, bufnr)
      client.server_capabilities.semanticTokensProvider = nil
      -- client.server_capabilities.semanticTokensProvider = nil
      if client.supports_method(vim.lsp.protocol.Methods.textDocument_inlayHint) then
        vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable(bufnr, true)
      end
    end,
  })
end
```
* Problem 1: open a file, and after the `inlay hints` are displayed, you can reproduce it through the `:edit` command.
* Problem 2: open a new file, run the `:bd` command after `inlay hints` are displayed, then reopen the file and run the `:bd` command. Finally, when you reopen the file, you will find that the `inlay hints` are gone.

> Would it be possible to add a test case for this?

I'll give it a try, but I need some time to learn how to write tests in neovim
The fix in the PR looks reasonable to me

Never knew how I was always triggering this, but it's VERY annoying in a large project cause I always had to restart nvim and the lsp.

Here is a test that works partially. "Problem 1" is solved, but the test doesn't seem to restore the inlay hints as described in "Problem 2" in @Spxg 's comment above.
Also I have no idea what to call the test, so please change that to a correct description.

Leaving it here so someone can get the test to work and merge this.

Run with: `TEST_FILE="test/functional/plugin/lsp/inlay_hint_spec.lua" make functionaltest`

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/plugin/lsp/inlay_hint_spec.lua b/test/functional/plugin/lsp/inlay_hint_spec.lua
index 192797b31..95d9facbc 100644
--- a/test/functional/plugin/lsp/inlay_hint_spec.lua
+++ b/test/functional/plugin/lsp/inlay_hint_spec.lua
@@ -133,6 +133,22 @@ describe('vim.lsp.inlay_hint', function()
     end)
   end)

+  describe('when detatched and on_win is called', function()
+    it('reattached inlay hints', function()
+      exec_lua([[vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable(bufnr, true)]])
+      screen:expect({ grid = grid_with_inlay_hints, unchanged = true })
+
+      exec_lua([[vim.cmd.write("test_inlay.txt")]])
+      exec_lua([[vim.cmd.echo('""')]]) -- clear cmdline after write
+      exec_lua([[vim.cmd.edit()]])
+
+      screen:expect({ grid = grid_with_inlay_hints, unchanged = true })
+    end)
+    after_each(function()
+        os.remove('test_inlay.txt')
+    end)
+  end)
+
   describe('get()', function()
     it('returns filtered inlay hints', function()
       --- @type lsp.InlayHint[]
```

@Spxg looking at this again. I noticed that once you `:edit` the buffer with the inlay hints, the hints do not come back. Is it possible to get them to reappear without having to open and close the buffer? I guess it's unlikely that someone would call `:edit`, so it's not really a big deal.

> @Spxg looking at this again. I noticed that once you `:edit` the buffer with the inlay hints, the hints do not come back. Is it possible to get them to reappear without having to open and close the buffer? I guess it's unlikely that someone would call `:edit`, so it's not really a big deal.

``` 
on_attach = function(client, bufnr)
  client.server_capabilities.semanticTokensProvider = nil
  -- client.server_capabilities.semanticTokensProvider = nil
  if client.supports_method(vim.lsp.protocol.Methods.textDocument_inlayHint) then
    vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable(bufnr, true)
  end
end,
``` 
In my lsp configuration, `on_attach` is set. If the lsp supports `inlay hints`, it will be enabled for this buffer, so `inlay hints` will reappear.

@Spxg are you able to create a test so we can get this merged? You can use my example above, or I can help out. Just let me know.

> In my lsp configuration, `on_attach` is set. If the lsp supports `inlay hints`, it will be enabled for this buffer, so `inlay hints` will reappear.

I have this too in my server config for rust-analyzer (rustacean.nvim) : 
```lua
on_attach = function(_, bufnr)
    vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable(bufnr) --- <-------
    require("config.keymaps").lsp_attach(bufnr)
end
```

> I have this too in my server config for rust-analyzer (rustacean.nvim) :

Is it not working properly? You can try my configuration above, just using `nvim-lspconfig`.


> are you able to create a test so we can get this merged? You can use my example above, or I can help out. Just let me know.
> 
> >

Thanks for your example, it's helpful. It successfully reproduces the panic caused by `:edit` under the current neovim version. The question now is how to re-enable `inlay hints` for the current buffer during testing, because `:edit` triggers detach, which causes `inlay hints` to be disabled. I tried enable but it didn't work.

> I guess it's unlikely that someone would call `:edit`, so it's not really a big deal.

`:edit` is useful to re-edit the current file, when it has been changed outside of neovim, such as git.

@Spxg
> The question now is how to re-enable inlay hints for the current buffer during testing

I'm not qualified to answer this, but my guess is that the fake lsp server used in the tests will need to support "experimental/serverStatus" and the client config needs to have the handler for this in order to do the re-enabling after :edit. As you said, this is what is toggling the inlay-hints back on. 

Someone else may be able to confirm, but I believe "experimental/serverStatus" is [a rust-analyzer capability](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust-analyzer/blob/master/docs/dev/lsp-extensions.md#server-status) only.

If this is the case, perhaps the test that I provided above is enough, minus the final `screen:expect`, just to show that there is no longer an error being thrown.

We can add another test that is showing the :bdelete and reopen behavior too.

Immediately after I wrote the last comment I updated rustacean.nvim (successor of rust-tools.nvim)...and the issue went away.

https://github.com/mrcjkb/rustaceanvim/issues/250
https://github.com/mrcjkb/rustaceanvim/commit/5fb048d9a59872547f9ed94b964cf4b35ed6c2fc

Amazing!

title: fix(lsp): reset `applied` and the events when `bufstate` is not enabled
